alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 1:20AM CDT until June 16 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... South Central Escambia County in northwestern Florida... * Until 515 AM CDT. * At 120 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated repeated rounds of thunderstorms producing torrential downpours across the warned area. Doppler radar indicates that 3 to 6 inches of rain has already fallen around the communities of Malbis, Loxley, Rosinton, Robertsdale, and Elsanor, with isolated amounts over 8 inches near the community of Lillian. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Daphne, Robertsdale, Loxley, Lillian, Silverhill, Elsanor, Rosinton, Seminole, Belforest, Malbis, Perdido Heights, Paradise Beach and Pleasant Grove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
